sources.title: The Big Gundown (1966)
sources.description: "The Big Gundown" is a 1966 Italian-Spanish spaghetti western film directed by Sergio Sollima .The film stars Lee Van Cleef as a relentless bounty hunter, Jonathan Corbett , who is tasked with capturing a man wrongly accused of rape and murder. The narrative unfolds in a landscape marked by moral ambiguity, where Corbett's pursuit leads him into confrontations with various characters, including an enigmatic outlaw.

metadata.Plot: Jonathan Corbett is a gunman so brave to have eliminated all the bandits of Texas. For this he is proposed for the candidacy to the Senate of the United States. In exchange he has only to support the construction of one railway line. Only after he accepts does he come to know that the Mexican Cuchillo has raped and killed a 12 year old girl. Corbett leaves on a long manhunt during which he gets to know his adversary better and discovers a variation on the crime for which the accused Cuchillo may not be as guilty as he first thought.
metadata.Writer: Franco Solinas, Fernando Morandi, Sergio Donati
metadata.Actors: Lee Van Cleef, Tomas Milian, Walter Barnes
